J.label: Objective Functions:
J.setToolTip:
Enter the objective functions to be minimized, separated by commas.
Variables can be started with the dollar sign ($).
Note: if multi-point optimization is active, each variable
must be indexed to ensure the return type is a float rather
that a list. For example, $Cd[0] must be used rather than
$Cd if multi-point optimization is active. Here, $Cd[0]
corresponds to the drag coefficient of the airfoil (system) evaluated
using the first multi-point stencil point values.

G.label: Constraints:
G.setToolTip:
Enter the constraint functions to be applied, separated by commas.
Variables can be started with the dollar sign ($).

additional_data.label: Additional Data
additional_data.setToolTip:
Additional variables to feed to the
objective or constraint functions

n_offspring.label: Number of Offspring
n_offspring.setToolTip:
Number of offspring to generate to fill out the population.
Offspring with converged objective functions become members of the
current population until the population is full. Must be greater
than or equal to the population size

max_sampling_width.label: Max. Sampling Width
max_sampling_width.setToolTip:
Maximum random distance from original (seed) parameter
 value for each active and unlinked parameter

algorithm_save_frequency.label: State Save Frequency
algorithm_save_frequency.setToolTip:
How often to save the setCheckState of the genetic algorithm.
A setValue of '1' enforces a setCheckState save every generation
